summary: James K. Conzelman is identified as a staff member of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). He appears in payroll certifications for the committee during the period of February 1977 through December 1977. The documents list his name and salary, indicating his employment with the committee during its investigation into the JFK assassination.
significance: James K. Conzelman's significance lies in his role as a staff member of the HSCA, contributing to the investigation into the JFK assassination. The payroll certifications confirm his involvement with the committee during a specific period of its operation.
